alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:37AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lafayette, southeastern Tate and Panola Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 737 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Como, or 7 miles southeast of Senatobia, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Senatobia, Batesville, John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Como, Pope, Barr, Pleasant Grove, Burgess, Courtland, Crossroad, Asa, Glenville, Hayes Crossing, Horatio, Cypress Corner, Eureka Springs, Bluff, Looxahoma and McGhee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
